page.title: 03Woodford Rose Queen Cont.
page.content: On the actual day of the gala a lot of local help is needed to run the various stalls and sideshows e.g.cake stall, white elephant.The gala also has fairground amusements. At 2.00p.m. the main part of the gala begins.This is the crowning of the Queens which takes place on a stage covered with crepe paper and ribbons.The procession leaves Woodford Recreation Ground led by a band and followed by morris dancers.When they arrive at the Community Centre they wait until 3.00 p.m. and then walk along the red carpet to the stage.A herald announces all the speeches and presentations. This year our headteacher,Mr Murray,crowned the Queens.After the crowning ceremony everyone goes and enjoys themselves.Throughout the afternoon bands,country dancers and morris dancers entertain.
